# Exercises
## Exercise 4.1
Consider a branching process with offspring distribution $\vec a = (a,b,c)$, where $a+b+c=1$. Let $P$ be the Markov transition matrix. Exhibit the first three rows of $P$. That is, find $P_{ij}$ for $i=0,1,2$ and $j=0,1,\dots$.

\soln Since 0 is an absorbing state, it can only transition to 0. For $i=0$, $P_{0j} = 0$ for all $j\ne 0$ and $P_{00} = 1$.

For $i=1$, the only individual in the generation can transition to $j=0,1,2$ with distribution $\vec a$, so
$$
P_{1j} = \begin{cases}
a & \textrm{for }j = 0 \\
b & \textrm{for }j = 1 \\
c & \textrm{for }j = 2 \\
0 & \textrm{otherwise}
\end{cases}
$$

For $i=2$, we can condition on the outcomes of each individual.
$$
P_{2j} = \begin{cases}
a^2 & \textrm{for }j = 0 \\
2ab & \textrm{for }j = 1 \\
2ab+c^2 & \textrm{for }j = 2 \\
2bc+ & \textrm{for }j = 3 \\
\end{cases}
$$
